description.narrative: By 2023, policy makers have increased capacity to plan, manage and monitor the education sector, including in emergency situations. , which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more preschool and school aged children benefit from an equitable, inclusive, quality education and acquire the necessary skills to continue their education or integrate into the labour market

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, policy makers have increased capacity to plan, manage and monitor the education sector, including in emergency situations.

description.narrative: As sector lead for Education among development partners, UNICEF supported the MoE to ensure regular dialogue between education partners. Five thematic subgroups (access, quality, higher education, vocational and technical training and sector monitoring) were established in 2019. The EMIS was consolidated with integration of indicators for education in emergencies, disability and gender-based violence, and through a national survey to update the Annual Education Census. With the MoE and AFD (French Development Agency), UNICEF facilitated the process of GPE (Global Partnership for Education) preparation and submission. The planning for an evaluation of the sector reform was completed for launch in 2020. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/01/2020

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance
An evaluation of thecurrent education reform is conducted with support from UNICEF
A renewed education sector plan is developped with support from UNICEF
